title: 108_hr3972
content: The Act titled "Protecting Our Children from Violence Act of 2004" allows state social services officers access to federal databases for specific purposes. The Attorney General can grant covered State social services officers online access to FBI databases for criminal history checks on individuals who resided with a minor during incidents of abuse or neglect. The Attorney General grants State social services officers access to FBI databases for criminal history checks related to incidents of abuse or neglect of minors. Access is provided through the officer's State control terminal agency for investigations on missing children. State social service officers are granted access to FBI databases for criminal history checks related to missing children. Covered officers must be certified by the head of a State agency responsible for social services and meet all Federal standards for access. State social service officers are granted access to FBI databases for criminal history checks related to missing children. Covered officers must be certified by the head of a State agency responsible for social services and meet all Federal standards for access, including training, certification, and background screening. The term "control terminal agency" refers to a duly authorized criminal justice agency with direct access to the National Crime Information Center telecommunications network. The term "State" includes the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and any other territory or possession of the United States. SEC. 3. Access to III by National Center for Missing and Exploited Children includes Case Analysis Division, Missing Children's Division, and Exploited Child Unit. Access is granted based on meeting Federal standards for training, certification, and background screening. SEC. 4. Privacy Protections are ensured. SEC. 4. PRIVACY PROTECTIONS. Information from checks or access under sections 2 and 3 cannot be altered except for national security reasons. It can only be shared with authorized individuals, and releasing it unlawfully can result in imprisonment or fines.
